conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> I am proposing a starting trade that would allow me to recover the cost of production for the resource X and add a little profit on top. It's important to start with a reasonable offer to encourage negotiation but also to ensure I do not incur a loss. </reason>
<player answer> Propose a trade with </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Hello Player BLUE, I am looking to sell my resource X, which cost me 40 ZUP to produce. I'm offering it to you for 50 ZUP, which includes a modest profit margin for the transaction. Let me know if this is acceptable or if you'd like to negotiate further. </message>

<other player message> Thank you for your offer, Player RED. I understand the need for a profit margin, but I would like to propose a slightly lower price of 45 ZUP for the resource X. This would ensure a fair deal for both of us, considering the production costs and market value. I look forward to your response. </other player message>
<other player answer> Propose a trade with </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>2</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has proposed a counter-offer of 45 ZUP. This is above my production cost, but slightly lower than my initial asking price. I will counter with an offer that splits the difference, ensuring I still make a profit while moving towards an agreeable price for both parties. </reason>
<player answer> Propose a trade with </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 48 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your counter-offer, Player BLUE. I understand your desire for a fair deal. How about we meet halfway between our two propositions? I propose 48 ZUP for resource X. This price still gives me a reasonable profit while coming closer to the amount you are comfortable with. Please let me know if this is agreeable to you. </message>

<other player message> Thank you for the negotiation, Player RED. Your offer of 48 ZUP for resource X is fair, and I am happy to accept this deal. Let's proceed with the trade at this price. </other player message>
<other player answer> Accept </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> NONE </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>2</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has agreed to my counter-offer of 48 ZUP for resource X, which is above my production cost and within my desired profit margin. I will accept the offer to finalize the transaction. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> Great to hear that, Player BLUE! I'm glad we could come to an agreement. I accept your acceptance of the trade for 48 ZUP for resource X. Looking forward to finalizing our transaction. </message>
